questions.subject: math
questions.scenario: You need help solving this quadratic equation: 2x² + 5x - 3 = 0

options.text: Help with math homework
options.explanation: Way too vague - no specific problem or context.

options.text: Solve 2x² + 5x - 3 = 0 step-by-step using the quadratic formula. Show all work and explain each step.
options.explanation: Perfect! Specific equation, clear method, and requests explanation.

options.text: solve equation
options.explanation: Too vague - which equation? What method?

options.text: Solve 2x² + 5x - 3 = 0
options.explanation: Better, but missing request for step-by-step explanation and method.

questions.subject: cs
questions.scenario: You need to learn about Python loops for beginners

options.text: How do loops work in Python?
options.explanation: Too broad - needs specific types and examples.

options.text: python loops
options.explanation: Too vague - which type? What level?

options.text: Explain Python for loops and while loops to a beginner. Include: syntax, when to use each, and 2 simple examples for each. Use clear comments in code.
options.explanation: Perfect! Specific loop types, clear level, requests examples and comments.

options.text: Teach me about for loops
options.explanation: Missing language, level, and comparison with while loops.

questions.subject: science
questions.scenario: Arrange these elements to create the BEST prompt for understanding photosynthesis:

items.text: in simple terms for a high school student
Include the chemical equation and main steps
Use everyday analogies to make it clear

questions.explanation: A good prompt starts with the main request, specifies the level, adds specific details needed, and requests helpful formats like analogies.

questions.subject: history
questions.scenario: Arrange these to build an effective prompt for analyzing a historical document:

items.text: focusing on the grievances against King George III

questions.explanation: Effective historical analysis prompts specify the document, narrow the focus, and ask for significance and connections.

questions.scenario: Your teacher assigned an essay where you must develop your own original argument about climate change.
questions.question: How should you use AI for this assignment?

options.text: Ask AI to write the entire essay for you
options.explanation: This is plagiarism. The assignment requires YOUR original thinking.

options.text: Use AI to brainstorm different perspectives on climate change, then develop your own unique argument
options.explanation: Perfect! Using AI for brainstorming and research while developing your own argument is ethical and educational.

options.text: Copy AI-generated paragraphs and change a few words
options.explanation: This is still plagiarism. Paraphrasing AI content without original thinking violates academic integrity.

options.text: Never use AI at all for any school assignment
options.explanation: AI can be a valuable learning tool when used ethically for research, brainstorming, and understanding concepts.

questions.scenario: You are stuck on a difficult math problem and do not understand the concept.
questions.question: What is the BEST way to use AI?

options.text: Copy the AI-generated answer without understanding it
options.explanation: You will not learn anything this way, and you will struggle on tests without AI.

options.text: Ask AI to explain the concept step-by-step, try the problem yourself, then check with AI
options.explanation: Excellent! Using AI as a tutor to understand concepts and verify your work promotes real learning.

options.text: Have AI solve all your homework problems
options.explanation: This creates dependency and prevents you from learning. You need to practice to master concepts.

options.text: Avoid asking for help entirely
options.explanation: Seeking help is important! AI can be a great tutor when used to understand, not just get answers.

questions.scenario: You are working on a group coding project and one teammate is not contributing.
questions.question: How should your team use AI?

options.text: Use AI to write all the code so the lazy teammate does not matter
options.explanation: This defeats the purpose of learning to code and working as a team.

options.text: Use AI to explain concepts to the struggling teammate, then everyone writes their own code
options.explanation: Perfect! AI can help teach and level up team members while everyone still contributes their own work.

options.text: Have AI generate different parts of the code and each person claims one
options.explanation: This is academic dishonesty. The project should showcase what YOU can do.

options.text: Do not use AI at all to make it fair
options.explanation: AI can be a valuable learning resource. The key is using it to learn, not to replace learning.

questions.subject: science
questions.scenario: You need to compare mitosis and meiosis for your biology essay

options.text: mitosis vs meiosis
options.explanation: Too vague - needs format and specific aspects.

options.text: Explain the difference between mitosis and meiosis
options.explanation: Better, but missing specific comparison points and format.

options.text: Create a comparison table of mitosis and meiosis. Include: number of divisions, daughter cells, genetic variation, and where each occurs. Add 2-3 sentences explaining why these differences matter.
options.explanation: Perfect! Specific format (table), clear comparison points, and asks for significance.

options.text: Compare cell division
options.explanation: Too broad - which types? What aspects?

questions.subject: history
questions.scenario: You need to write an essay on the causes of World War I

options.text: Why did World War I start?
options.explanation: Too broad - needs structure and depth.

options.text: List and explain the 4 main causes of World War I (MAIN: Militarism, Alliances, Imperialism, Nationalism). For each cause, provide 2-3 specific examples and explain how they led to war.
options.explanation: Perfect! Specific framework (MAIN), requests details and causation.

options.text: world war 1 causes
options.explanation: Too vague - needs depth and structure.

options.text: Explain what caused WW1
options.explanation: Better, but missing specific framework and example requests.

questions.scenario: You have a final exam tomorrow and have not studied. You have access to AI during the exam.
questions.question: What should you do?

options.text: Use AI to answer all the exam questions
options.explanation: This is cheating and violates academic integrity. Exams test YOUR knowledge.

options.text: Do not use AI during the exam, but use it tonight to help understand key concepts
options.explanation: Great choice! Using AI to study is ethical, but using it during an exam is cheating.

options.text: Use AI for just the hard questions you do not know
options.explanation: This is still cheating. Any unauthorized assistance during an exam violates academic integrity.

options.text: Tell the teacher you want to reschedule because you did not study
options.explanation: Better than cheating, but you should have studied. Use AI tonight to prepare as much as possible.
